Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: cjgraham82
Reviews.Content: This was ok. The rooms - bathrooms especially - were slightly on the small side but they were clean and did the job. Slightly annoying that you couldn't get any food in the place once breakfast had finished but I'm picking at things really now. It's fairly cheap considering the location, and the free wifi is good. All in all, not a bad place for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for somebody who doesn't want to spend a lot of time in the hotel with a great central location!”
Reviews.Author: Rubikcube
Reviews.Content: I asked for a quiet room and I got one. The room was smaller than what I expected(despite the fact that they upgraded my superior room to a higher level, don't remember what it was called). I had to move some of the furniture to move around. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I was allowed an early check-in and a late check-out free of charge. The room wasn't fancy or spotless but comfortable and reasonably clean. The location is the best, it's close to an interchange metro station(Dhoby ghaut) and a big shopping center (Plaza Singapura) with a reasonable choices of restaurants around. Also I got the best rate of AUD to Sing$ in the exchange office in that Metro station. The room price was better comparing to the similar options I looked at on the net before I book my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: alwaysozmatt
Reviews.Content: Was in Singapore for a work conference and stayed at the Shangri-La. Having to pay for something myself for the weekend though, I looked around and chose Innotel. The location is amazing and the staff so accommodating. The rooms were fine, if compact, but I didn't go to Singapore to stay in my room. Everything is spotless but there are no facilities: No breakfast, no pool, no gym. But there are plenty of options around and the free wireless is more important to me than breakfast in such a "foody" city as Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Ben J
Reviews.Content: Arrived after midnight and was greeted by doorman who was very friendly. Check in was a breeze. Rooms are small, but have everything you need. Recently renovated Innotel is painted in funky colours which make the rooms bright and cheerful. 2 min walk to Dhoby (spelling?) MRT, which has 3 lines connected to it. Unofrtunately none of these go direct to the airport, but Singapore's MRT is one of the better ones I've used and transfer is relatively easy. Close to so many sights, if you dont want to catch the MRT, then taxis are plentiful and cheap. I was short on time so took cabs everywhere. Quick and cheap compared to Western countries. I was very happy with my stay at Innotel and would have no reservations recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, rooms and service ....”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 1 night at the end of February. We just had a slight incident with another guest who was very loud with his group. They also stayed on our floor and communicted from room to room by screeming and leaving their room doors open. Unbelievable !!! The efficient night manager Willie sorted this out in no time. The rooms are clean (NOT too small at all) and nicely decorated. The lan cable internet connection worked fast and relieable. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated, great beds, and well located!”
Reviews.Author: Sndra88
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at this property. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, especially the Bell Captain. Rooms have been recently renovated, and everything is new and clean. We booked through the Internet and got a really good rate on the room, though breakfast was not included. There are lots of restaurants nearby in the basements of malls where breakfast is cheap and lots of variety to choose from, so this is not a problem. We really liked how you can control the air conditioning in the room as many hotels do not have thermostat controls. The room is not large, but not tiny either be ause I've stayed in much smaller rooms in Singapore. Room is well designed with everything that you need and no space is wasted. The beds were very comfortable and the linens of good quality. This hotel is only a two minute walk to Orchard Rd. And the Doby Ghaut MRT station ( main interchange where 3 MRT lines meet), however, the side street that it is on has no through traffic and is very quiet at night. Very few families stay here because there is mo pool, and no gym, so it's great for older couples like us who just want quiet, clean, comfortable accomodation close to the heart of the action, for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Bruno139
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 weeks in January 2011. At that time, the place was quite new so the taxi driver had a hard time looking for it. By now, I expect that will no longer be the case. First impression is very reassuring, the hotel is spotlessly clean with cutting edge design. It actually borders on "Ikea-ish" but for me, I kinda liked it :) PROS : - Front office has superb staff. Check in and out was fast, even by Singapore standards. - Requests for directions and assistance was fast and efficient. - If you get past the Austin Powers theme, the rooms are very comfortable and well-designed, despite being quite small. - Complaint about a burnt smell in our first room was dealt with promptly by an apology and an upgrade to an even larger room! - Excellent location! Around the corner is a taxi-stand, a bus stop and it is a 2 minute walk to Dhoby Ghaut subway station, which connects to anywhere in Singapore. There is a small Hainanese chicken restaurant in the station just across the escalator...excellent chicken for 2.50SGD! - Very quiet at night, too quiet even. I don't mind noise, but I know some travelers do. CONS : - uhhm...none actually ;) TIPS : - If you go to the Mustafa electronics store at night, it will be impossible to grab a taxi going home. Arguments with other people waiting will be entirely possible. Cross Farrer Park in front, there's a subway station at the other end. You'll save yourselves the stress. - There are 2 famous Hainanese chicken restaurants in Singapore. WEE NAM KEE has better chicken. BOON TONG KEE has better cereal prawns. I would definitely stay at Hotel Innotel again. Definitely a great value in expensive Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SeetheworldfromDevon
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at Innotel, sadly, but my son has, having travelled from his home in Manila, prior to surgery in Singapore. Whilst he tells me that it is a lovely, peaceful and spotlessly clean hotel, the reason I am writing this review is to praise the wonderful service I experienced when I emailed the hotel from the UK to ask if they could place some chocolates in my son's room. This they did, two boxes with a message on a card from our family - but when I tried to pay they told me the chocolates would be complimentary. This kind and generous gesture means so much to us being so far away and I thank everyone at Innotel for making this small but important thing possible.

Reviews.Title: “maintains its good value”
Reviews.Author: drarbee
Reviews.Content: Im a return customer, staff is friendly, , rooms are new and clean, WiFi complementary; location is good, not exactly a steel (no gym and pool) and certainly not a family hotel

Reviews.Title: “just OK”
Reviews.Author: SaberKL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days Positive - clean room - good customer service - prompt response in terms of request for things - facilitative (namely Mr. Willie) - hotel very close to MRT Dhoby Ghaut and other shopping plazas along orchard road Negative - room so small - toilet's door cannot be locked and people bathing can be seen from outside the toilet - TV channel insufficient ; no cartoon channel, 4 channels on sports (not all guest are Sport lover),1 channel for movie,3 channel for news - no prayer mat for Muslim - not enough choice of Halal food at surrounding area nearby (available only during working days/hours) - small pathway along corridor,hard to turn strollers

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good. We stayed twice.”
Reviews.Content: Best feature: location, location, location. Hotel Innotel is the perfect base. This new hotel is a 1.5 minute walk to Orchard Road, less than minute walk from Dhoby Ghot station and buses, less than 5 minutes to Fort Canning. Although the budget hotel does not offer additional goodies (gym, spa, busness centre, etc.), it’s a solid choice with the “boutique hotels” that are cropping up in Singapore offering a good value (Singapore lodgings can be expensive for travellers. Mandarin Oriental, anyone? Or a hostel dorm,? FYI, YHA private rooms are a comparable price). The modern décor room is clean and has all the necessary items (safe, laundry, etc.) needed to complete your stay. Bathrooms were compact and showers (no bath) had good pressure and hot water. Our second time, we could hear the large family that occupied 3 rooms as they conversed in the hallway. Thin walls or were they just loud? Not sure. Never heard anything the first time. We stayed a total of 4 nights. Staff and management were wonderful and accommodating during our stay. Catering to budget business travellers, it is also well suited to elite backpackers ($$ with spare cash) and families. Check-in was quick, good security, no baggage storage charge. Free wi-fi and pay internet terminal (at reception), with café (never tried). Taxi stand (30sec. walk) at the mall. Many shopping malls, restaurants/hawker’s centres, sites nearby. travellers from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CarolCCL
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and clean room but quite small. Room are not sound resistance as I can always hear door closing that sounds like door slamming every morning. Do expect it as a boutique hotel with no bath tub, but I think it's a lil pricy for a small hotel like this, however I was there for business trip and expenses covered by the company so no big deal for me. Location is very good as it's just 5 minutes walking distance to the nearby dhoby ghaut MRT station and Plaza Singapura. Ideal for those who doesnt want to stay right in the busy district of Orchard road and still want to access to different places by public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but don't expect anything more than a lo-end 3* venue...”
Reviews.Author: gbodis
Reviews.Content: ... and if you know the low end 3* hotels in Singapore, you know what I mean. No lobby, very small room, even smaller bathroom (just shower + toilet, no wash basin....). The hotel can charge these prices only because its relatively good location. Worth it? Definitely not. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “good location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: drarbee
Reviews.Content: 2 mins to bus stop, 5 mins to MRT and shopping (Orchard); not boutique, rather budget. Rooms are very functional: free wifi, all amenities are there, a small coffee shop downstairs as well. Not quite sure why they put a girlie bar on the 2nd floor? At 180 SGD competitively priced, but not exactly a steal either Would I come back: yes given location/price/cleanliness NOT a family place (especially not with small kids, since there is no pool) No gym

Reviews.Title: “Not that great.”
Reviews.Author: wireless_md
Reviews.Content: Upon checking the website, it showed photos of the different rooms and bathrooms. It did not however specify that the superior rooms did not have a bathtub despite it showing a photo of it in its gallery. It was quite disappointing to find out only upon arrival that the superior room did not have a bathtub. Rooms for upgrade were not available at that time and the staff did not show any effort to make up for the misleading information on the website. Upon arriving in the rooms, the bed had a few hair strands and surprisingly, pubic hair. The bathroom looked clean but did not smell clean. Underneath the bed, we found 3 receipts from previous guests. They gave a box of tooth brush, tooth paste, shaver with cream, etc every day however on the last day, the box they gave was already open and used by someone else because the shaving cream was already open and used without the shaver in the box. Staff were helpful when asked about directions. Location was a good 3-minute walk from Dhoby Ghaut Station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: felixinbali
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and was upgraded for free to a higher category. Very nice new room. Not the biggest room but everything was new and pleasant. Great location next to MRT station (3 minutes walk, 2 stations to Orchard) and shopping mall (Plaza Singapura). Staff was helpful and found my mobile phone charger which I left at the room when I checked out. My room included free internet. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice room but was not clean”
Reviews.Author: dalozt
Reviews.Content: I was told that this super minimalist (everything is mini) hotel was open in January 2011 so I would like to try. Overall the service quality is excellent, the check in was lightning fast, the staffs were so friendly. When I entered the room, the room was excellent, I love the room but when I was about to sleep on the best, I saw on the bed floor hair everywhere and dust has form into some sort of cotton under our bedside table. Then when I walked around, my feet started to collected a lot of dust particle so It was bad. Furthermore I was given a non-smoking room because I have an allergic to smoke but from the ventilation or exhaust the smoke smell keep entering the room all day. But despite that, the breakfast was good although did not give many options, there were fried rice, porridge, ham, sausage, hush-brown, scramble egg and red beans. But It was all nice.

Reviews.Title: “Budget - Not Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Denise07012
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in February. Superior room on the 3rd floor, then a week later on 5th floor. I paid SGD$180/Aust$147 (including Breakfast, Newspaper & Wireless Broadband Internet Access in Room). I certainly wouldn’t pay more than that. Positives: Great Location (5 mins walk to Dhoby Ghaut MRT Station & Plaza Singapura) Large and comfortable bed. Staff friendly and generally efficient Excellent Wifi Internet access in room if you bring your Laptop. Negatives: Poor quality finishes, particularly the bathroom cubicle. Water temperature in sink & shower - variable. Either lukewarm or very hot. Mould on the grout in the shower. The long white bench along one wall was marked and scuffed already and the carpet was stained (its only a new hotel). Breakfast - strange having to walk out on pavement and sit at little outdoor cafe looking over the lane at car-parking garages. Very little lighting in breakfast area between 7am and 8am. Breakfast staff didn’t seem ready for the 7am start - still setting up chairs & some food items missing. Rather limited choice and amount of foods. Hotel has limited facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best thing about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chezong
Reviews.Content: It's relatively new, it's clean, modern and the highlight was the kingsize bed and pillows - which were extremely comfortable. The room is considered decent size for Spore standards - big enough to fit 2 large size suitcases. They advertised themselves as a boutique hotel - which I don't agree with, as there is nothing special about their rooms or service at all to qualify them as "boutique". It's more like a budget hotel in terms of amenities - basic and comfortable. Breakfast also basic and just edible. The location is very convenient, lots of buses to Orchard Rd (5mins ride) and MRT train station is also a 5 min walk away. I would stay at this hotel again purely for the location, althou not sure that I'd pay SGD$200 again. Then again hotels in Spore are really not cheap anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the heart of City”
Reviews.Author: S_Chew
Reviews.Content: This is a very new hotel, only established in Nov 2010. It was only 2 mths old when I stayed. 5 mins walk to Dhoby Ghaut MRT, very convenient. Modern Superior Room with LCD TV, standing shower (frosted glass though), very good and comfortable King size bed with choices of pillows (hard, medium or soft). Efficient and helpful staff, quick check in and helped us to call Maxi cab to airport on rainy morning. Free WIFI too. Very good hotel as I don't drive (heard there is no car park)! Definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: tasiwafam
Reviews.Content: the hotel was just open... it`s on orchard road but very nice and quite... it has a good location, only 3 minutes walk from dobygout station and plaza singapore....

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark362
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. It is very clean, great staff and ideal location - rooms are very modern and have everything you need for a business trip. It is 5 mins from Dhoby Ghaut MRT and within walking distance (10-15 mins) of Orchard Road. The hotel is very small - the lobby has about three chairs whilst waiting and so there is nowhere to sit at busy check out-in times - the room is also small especially the bathromm which has no bath - fine for solo or couples but would not work with kids in tow. Breakfast is limited but fine - the food in Singapore is so good you should not be filling up on hotel breakfasts anyway - Staff are great - they really go out of their way for you - Got the hotel on a promotion so was cheap - maybe a tough sell if it comes up against the larger hotels without the price cut though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pokeyboy
Reviews.Content: very good hotel, cozy, near bus and MRT station, near singapore plaza. The room is clean and stylish, with LCD TV, AC, Refrigerator, nice bathroom, nice Bed, nice staff..But I must say the hotel is little bit small for 4 stars hotel..and the breakfast a lil bit standard for 4 stars hotel. It is in the middle of Dhobby Ghaut...So it only takes a minute to orchard, clarke quay, esplanade,sommerset and china town

Reviews.Title: “One night stand”
Reviews.Author: Ozejim
Reviews.Content: Innotel is a very modern hotel. Rooms are small but comfortable. Breakfast was not a highlight but the cleanliness of the rooms was.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JGio
Reviews.Content: Innotel is a boutique hotel and the design are very modern. The room is nice except it is too small.the bathroom is good. but They don't serve many kind of breakfast. I must say the location is very good if you don't bring car, because here is no parking place for cars, but if you go without cars, the location of this hotel is very strategic, there are 2 bus stations near the hotel and there is MRT station across the hotel, Dhoby Ghaut MRT station. And it only takes 10 minutes to fort canning museum and clarke quay by walk and it only takes 15 minutes to sommerset and orchad area
